name: People Module Training
title: People Module Training
body:
Overview

The People module combines a powerful panel management, a content management system for designing the panel website, and the functions of the Enterprise Feedback Suite, the basic platform for performing data collection processes.

You can employ all the tools you already know from EFS in creating, conducting, and evaluating online surveys. People module is designed to manage panels with over 100,000 participants.

For detailed information, please check the People topic article.

The People module consists of several components, and the below list you help you get a better grasp of the module:

  • Groups (Subpanels)
  • Panelist administration
  • Contacts
  • Panel configuration

Deliverables

You should have already completed the Projects Module Training (if you haven't, get to that first), so you have access to the test instance and are already familiar with the looks of DXI. Please complete the following hands-on activities:

  1. Build a panel and import some panelist following How-to: Efficient Panelist Management in the People Module
  2. Follow How-to: Automating Processes in the People Module and complete the setup for for the 3 highlighted scenarios:
    1. Scenario 1: Employee Panel Onboarding
    2. Scenario 2: Automated Birthday Emails
    3. Scenario 3: Panelist Compliance Index (PCI) Management

Additional sub-topics

Master Data

Master Data in EFS Panel refers to the basic characteristics of panelists that are specified by the panel administrator. This data is stored independently from specific survey projects and is always available for evaluation purposes or for creating subpanels, which are also known as "groups."

People Data Export

The People module offers different export interfaces for master data, result data, address data, projects, layouts, and other information. This guide focuses on exporting panelists' master data, participant data, and SPSS labels for master data in order to allow for further external manipulation and processing.

Statistics (People)

Considering the nature of the software, DXI customers will make heavy use of the statistics, in order to draw insightful data from the surveys. The statistics cover various areas and allow for comprehensive analysis of the survey results.
